name: wrasse
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
any of a group of fish that are usually brightly coloured and have thick lips and teeth that stick outwards : Most of these species of wrasse are found in shallow coastal waters. All green wrasse shorter than 28 centimetres are female.
Hal Beral/The Image Bank/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesThis wrasse has fleshy lips, a single row of conical shaped teeth, and a small eye.Like most wrasse, it is known to change sex (from female to male).This wrasse is very common and is found in a variety of habitats.
